title: The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers
data:
**The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers** is a special level that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It has a 1⁄2 chance of generating between levels 26 and 31.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 The level](#The_level)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Athames and Hawaiian shirts](#Athames_and_Hawaiian_shirts)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 Reference](#Reference)

## The level

An example map.

                         -----                 --------------  
                         |  [>](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")[+](/wiki/Door "Door")#                |....[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")\*.|  
                       ##|[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")  |#               #[+](/wiki/Door "Door")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")?.[!](/wiki/Potion "Potion").[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").[!](/wiki/Potion "Potion")|

             |      |#     #  #           #    |f?.[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[!](/wiki/Potion "Potion").[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")..[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")[@](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster")-########  
             | [<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase")    |#     #####        ###    -----|--------       #

                                                   |[^](/wiki/Trap "Trap")            |  
                                                   ---------------

It is a rooms-and-corridors level, with one bigger 12X6 room containing various [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").

The player monsters are:

- two [archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)")
- two [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)")
- a [caveman](/wiki/Caveman_\(player_monster\) "Caveman (player monster)") and a [cavewoman](/wiki/Cavewoman_\(player_monster\) "Cavewoman (player monster)")
- two [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger")
- two [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster\) "Elf (monster)")
- two [flame mages](/wiki/Flame_mage_\(player_monster\) "Flame mage (player monster)")
- two [healers](/wiki/Healer_\(player_monster\) "Healer (player monster)")
- two [ice mages](/wiki/Ice_mage_\(player_monster\) "Ice mage (player monster)")
- two [knights](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)")
- two [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)")
- two [necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer_\(player_monster\) "Necromancer (player monster)")
- a [priest](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)") and a [priestess](/wiki/Priestess_\(player_monster\) "Priestess (player monster)")
- two [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)")
- two [samurai](/wiki/Samurai_\(player_monster\) "Samurai (player monster)")
- two [tourists](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)")
- two [undead slayers](/wiki/Undead_slayer_\(player_monster\) "Undead slayer (player monster)")
- two [valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)")
- two [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)")

* in [SLASHTHEM](/wiki/SLASHTHEM "SLASHTHEM"), also a [padawan](/wiki/Padawan_\(player_monster\) "Padawan (player monster)") and a [jedi](/wiki/Jedi_\(player_monster\) "Jedi (player monster)").

The 12X6 room also contains: four random scrolls, two random wands, three random potions, ten random objects.

The rest of the level is five ordinary rooms with three random traps and six random objects.

## Strategy

Note that most of these are not [sleep resistant](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), so knowing the [sleep spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_sleep "Spellbook of sleep") or having lots of [wands of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep") can be handy. Done right with sleep rays, this level can generate a large amount of loot. In the confusion, try not to put a [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation") in your [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding")/[Wallet of Perseus](/wiki/Wallet_of_Perseus "Wallet of Perseus").

The Adventurers will come equipped with a wide variety of wands and potions, so be prepared. The three greatest threats are usually [wands of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"), [wands of fireball](/wiki/Wand_of_fireball "Wand of fireball"), and [wands of draining](/wiki/Wand_of_draining "Wand of draining"): the first is of course counteracted by [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), the second only by [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") (NOT reflection), and the third by [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance").

Also note, that the two [archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)") might have pickaxes, and use them to dig around complicating strategy.

### [Athames](/wiki/Athame "Athame") and [Hawaiian shirts](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt")

Of note, is the fact that here you can easily find [athames](/wiki/Athame "Athame") and [Hawaiian shirts](/wiki/Hawaiian_shirt "Hawaiian shirt"), two items that are otherwise hard to get.

The two [ice mages](/wiki/Ice_mage_\(player_monster\) "Ice mage (player monster)"), two [flame mages](/wiki/Flame_mage_\(player_monster\) "Flame mage (player monster)") and two [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") will certainly generate several athames, while the [tourists](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)") will generate two Hawaiian shirts.

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")
- [Bar (SpliceHack)](/wiki/Bar_\(SpliceHack\) "Bar (SpliceHack)")

## Reference

From source guild.des file

html:
The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers is a special level that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It has a 1⁄2 chance of generating between levels 26 and 31.

Contents

  • 1 The level
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Athames and Hawaiian shirts
  • 3 See also
  • 4 Reference

The level

An example map.

                         -----                 --------------
                         |  >+#                |....@@.@@@*.|
                       ##|^  |#               #+@?.!.@@.@@.!|
             --------  # |   |#             ###|..@...@@.@@@|
             |      |### -.---#             #  |..@@@.@.@@@@|
             |      |#    ##  #           ###  |...@%..@D@@@|
             |      |#     #  #           #    |f?.@!.@@..@@-########
             | <    |#     #####        ###    -----|--------       #
             |      .#      #--+-+------#           #               ### ------
             |      |       #|         |#           #                 # |    |
             --------        |         |#           #                 ##.    |
                             |         |#           #                   |    |
                             |         +#           #                   |  ^ |
                             |         |   ####################         ------
                             -----------           --------+--|---
                                                   |             |
                                                   |             |
                                                   |^            |
                                                   ---------------

It is a rooms-and-corridors level, with one bigger 12X6 room containing various player monsters.

The player monsters are:

  • two archeologists
  • two barbarians
  • a caveman and a cavewoman
  • two doppelgangers
  • two elves
  • two flame mages
  • two healers
  • two ice mages
  • two knights
  • two monks
  • two necromancers
  • a priest and a priestess
  • two rogues
  • two samurai
  • two tourists
  • two undead slayers
  • two valkyries
  • two wizards
  • in SLASHTHEM, also a padawan and a jedi.

The 12X6 room also contains: four random scrolls, two random wands, three random potions, ten random objects.

The rest of the level is five ordinary rooms with three random traps and six random objects.

Strategy

Note that most of these are not sleep resistant, so knowing the sleep spell or having lots of wands of sleep can be handy. Done right with sleep rays, this level can generate a large amount of loot. In the confusion, try not to put a wand of cancellation in your bag of holding/Wallet of Perseus.

The Adventurers will come equipped with a wide variety of wands and potions, so be prepared. The three greatest threats are usually wands of death, wands of fireball, and wands of draining: the first is of course counteracted by reflection or magic resistance, the second only by fire resistance (NOT reflection), and the third by drain resistance.

Also note, that the two archeologists might have pickaxes, and use them to dig around complicating strategy.

Athames and Hawaiian shirts

Of note, is the fact that here you can easily find athames and Hawaiian shirts, two items that are otherwise hard to get.

The two ice mages, two flame mages and two wizards will certainly generate several athames, while the tourists will generate two Hawaiian shirts.

See also

  • Special level (SLASH'EM)
  • Bar (SpliceHack)

Reference

From source guild.des file

It is a rooms-and-corridors level, with one bigger 12X6 room containing various [[player monster]]s. The player monsters are: * two [[archeologist (player monster)|archeologists]] * two [[barbarian (player monster)|barbarians]] * a [[caveman (player monster)|caveman]] and a [[cavewoman (player monster)|cavewoman]] * two [[doppelganger]]s * two [[Elf (monster)|elves]] * two [[flame mage (player monster)|flame mages]] * two [[Healer (player monster)|healers]] * two [[ice mage (player monster)|ice mages]] * two [[Knight (player monster)|knights]] * two [[Monk (player monster)|monks]] * two [[Necromancer (player monster)|necromancers]] * a [[Priest (player monster)|priest]] and a [[Priestess (player monster)|priestess]] * two [[rogue (player monster)|rogues]] * two [[samurai (player monster)|samurai]] * two [[Tourist (player monster)|tourists]] * two [[Undead slayer (player monster)|undead slayers]] * two [[Valkyrie (player monster)|valkyries]] * two [[Wizard (player monster)|wizards]] * in [[SLASHTHEM]], also a [[padawan (player monster)|padawan]] and a [[Jedi (player monster)|jedi]]. The 12X6 room also contains: four random scrolls, two random wands, three random potions, ten random objects. The rest of the level is five ordinary rooms with three random traps and six random objects. ==Strategy== Note that most of these are not [[Sleep resistance|sleep resistant]], so knowing the [[Spellbook of sleep|sleep spell]] or having lots of [[Wand of sleep|wands of sleep]] can be handy. Done right with sleep rays, this level can generate a large amount of loot. In the confusion, try not to put a [[wand of cancellation]] in your [[bag of holding]]/[[Wallet of Perseus]]. The Adventurers will come equipped with a wide variety of wands and potions, so be prepared. The three greatest threats are usually [[wand of death|wands of death]], [[wand of fireball|wands of fireball]], and [[wand of draining|wands of draining]]: the first is of course counteracted by [[reflection]] or [[magic resistance]], the second only by [[fire resistance]] (NOT reflection), and the third by [[drain resistance]]. Also note, that the two [[archeologist (player monster)|archeologists]] might have pickaxes, and use them to dig around complicating strategy. ===[[Athame]]s and [[Hawaiian shirt]]s=== Of note, is the fact that here you can easily find [[athame]]s and [[Hawaiian shirt]]s, two items that are otherwise hard to get. The two [[ice mage (player monster)|ice mages]], two [[flame mage (player monster)|flame mages]] and two [[Wizard (player monster)|wizards]] will certainly generate several athames, while the [[Tourist (player monster)|tourists]] will generate two Hawaiian shirts. ==See also== *[[Special level (SLASH'EM)]] *[[Bar (SpliceHack)]] ==Reference== From source guild.des file {{slashem-7E7|offset=1}} {{variant-343}} [[Category:SLASH'EM special levels]] [[Category:SlashTHEM special levels]] [[Category:Hack'EM special levels]]
